lines.text:
[Repeated often with variations]
I am, but if I'm wrong, I'll apologize.

[Reading from a sign]
'Al Taurez Seaman's Association.' Good old Al!
A clue?
Back in the States Al was always a clue.
This Mr. Taurez seems to be a man of generous nature.
Al would give his best friend a knife in the back any day.

[Ironically, after seeing Taurez play with a parakeet after throwing a knife in the back of an associate]
Did yuh ever see such a soft-hearted guy as Al?
I don't know what you're talkin' about! Bombs? I never seen no bombs! What would I be doin' with a bomb anyway?
Well, you're either a very smart liar or really as dumb as you look. I don't know which.

[Feeling insulted]
Don't call me dumb!
Steady - or I'll draw a bead on you right between the eyes.

[Fuming]
why, you, you... someday I'll find a name for you!
Al, you look different.
Perhaps you miss the handcuffs.

[after Taurez introduces him to all the riffraff in his club]
Say, you know I'm on a vacation. What's the idea of putting the finger on me?
Oh, you're mistaken, Nick.
Oh. Oh, but you're a liar, Al, and if I'm wrong...

[Anticipating]
... you'll apologize, I know.
Where do we go from here, keed?
Maybe Al can answer that?
Ah, look, Nick, the past is over and done with. Can't we be friends?
Sure, why not? You're a man after my own heart... with a knife.

[as Nick comes out the door]
This note was waiting for you at the hotel.

[Reading the note]
'Please meet me in my office at seven o'clock... Franklin Morris.' Wonder what Morris could want with me?
Mysterious... it's several hours to seven o'clock.
Oh, but so much to be done.
Yes... yes.
Let's see...
Let's see.
Where do we begin?
Ah... where?
I've got it!
Yes, yes, of course.
Ah, Al Taurez.
We check.
Keep you smile, Deadeye.

[as Carter begins to search MacMillan, he giggles as if he's being tickled]
Oh, you're a nice boy. Written home to your mother lately?

[Indignant]
You keep our mothers out of this!
Nice work, Beeswax. How does it feel to be crazy?
I didn't notice any difference.
